ai.summary: A challenging 15.4 km hike on rugged, exposed terrain in the UK, featuring steep ascents and variable conditions. Not suited for beginners; be prepared for a long, demanding day.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect rocky tracks, uneven footing, potential scree, and some exposed ridges. Navigation can be tricky in low visibility; suitable for hikers with good fitness and balance. Weather can change rapidly in UK hills, so plan accordingly.
ai.safety_notes: Check the forecast before you go; UK weather can change rapidly. Wear sturdy boots with ankle support, dress in layers, and bring a waterproof shell. Carry a map and compass (or a GPS device) and know the route. Tell someone your planned route and expected return time. Stay on marked paths; exercise caution on exposed edges and rough ground. Bring enough water and high-energy snacks; monitor hydration and energy. Pack a basic first aid kit, emergency whistle, and a space blanket. If visibility deteriorates or conditions worsen, be prepared to turn back.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with ankle support
Map and compass or GPS device
Water bottle or hydration system + extra fluids
Headlamp or flashlight with spare batteries
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn are generally best for Bolaght Mountain hikes due to longer daylight and milder weather; winter conditions can be severe and require advanced skills and equipment.
